title.narrative: SUPPORTING GREATER MEDIA INDEPENDENCE IN THE WESTERN BALKANS (Media for All)

description.narrative: Media outlets in the Western Balkans and their audience, Media professionals (especially female journalists and chief editors), Donors and implementation partners: EU delegations, OSCE missions, UNDP offices, Deutsche Welle, Internew, Host governments and relevant bodies, Journalist associations, Young journalists, Youth Media outlets

The Media for All (Supporting Greater Media Independence in the Western Balkans) programme works with journalists, editors, owners and audiences across the Western Balkans (Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Kosovo, Montenegro, North Macedonia and Serbia). Providing tailored business development support, enhancing two-way communications with citizens and media outlets, supporting youth media outlets and young journalists and strengthening gender sensitive reporting.

• Tailored business development support and capacity building (Media Accelerator) • Enhancing two-way communications with citizens and media outlets (Engaged Citizens Reporting) • Supporting youth media outlets and young journalists (Youth Media and Youth Journalists) • Strengthening gender sensitive reporting and supporting women in the media (Women in the Media) • Training programmes, public debates and knowledge exchange (Media Incubator)

name.narrative: The Media for All is a regional project, delivered in six countries in Europe. The project is being delivered across the Western Balkans - Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Kosovo, Montenegro, North Macedonia and Serbia. The project main office is based in Belgrade, Serbia.
